messages.content: In just a few weeks, you have a choice to make about the future of our NHS, so I wanted to give you the facts about what is at stake.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will recruit 20,000 more nurses and 8,000 more GPs. Guarantee GP appointments within 48 hours and cancer tests and results within one week.
Labour will clamp down on tax avoidance and introduce a levy on tobacco firms and homes worth over £2 million.

issues.health: The Tories have set out plans for extreme spending cuts which put our NHS at risk. Ed Miliband, as the Labour leader, is focused on recruiting more nurses and GPs, ensuring quick GP appointments and cancer test results, and not putting the NHS at risk with extreme spending cuts.

housing.content: Introduce a levy on homes worth over £2 million.

leaflet.personalStatement: The choice at this election is clear: five more years of the Tories whose extreme plans threaten the NHS, or a Labour government that invests in more doctors and nurses.

images.caption: Images of Ed Miliband engaging with the public and professionals.
